Kernel/sources/cpu/cpuid_vendor.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #include "cpu.h"
00002 #include <printf.h>
00003 
00004 //Global string, used a buffer for the vendor string
00005 char VendorString[13];
00006 
00007 //Function: cpuidGetVendorReal
00008 //Arguments: a character buffer
00009 //Returns: None
00010 //Description: Moves the vendor string of a cpuid call to the char*
00011 void cpuidGetVendorReal(char* Buffer)
00012 {
00013         unsigned long input = 0;
00014 
00015         unsigned long ebx = 0;
00016         unsigned long edx = 0;
00017         unsigned long ecx = 0;
00018 
00019         asm volatile("movl %3, %%eax; \
00020                       cpuid; \
00021                       movl %%ecx, %2; \
00022                       movl %%ebx, %0; \
00023                       movl %%edx, %1; " : "=r" (ebx), "=r" (edx), "=r" (ecx) : "r" (input));
00024 
00025         memcpy(Buffer, &ebx, sizeof(unsigned long));
00026         memcpy(Buffer + sizeof(unsigned long), &edx, sizeof(unsigned long));
00027         memcpy(Buffer + sizeof(unsigned long) + sizeof(unsigned long), &ecx, sizeof(unsigned long));
00028         Buffer[12] = '\0'; //Terminate the vendor string
00029 
00030         return;
00031 }
00032 
00033 //Functions: cpuidGetVendor
00034 //Arguments: None
00035 //Returns: pointer to a 13 byte character array containing a null terminated vendor string
00036 //Description: Get the vendor string from the cpuid function
00037 const char* cpuidGetVendor()
00038 {
00039         //If cpuid isn't supported tell the user so
00040         if (!cpuidSupported()) return "Unsupported";
00041 
00042         //Copy unkown over before copying the vendor string
00043         strcpy(VendorString, "Unknown");
00044         cpuidGetVendorReal(VendorString);
00045 
00046         return VendorString;
00047 }
